DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Sudden increase of the number of blasts in the bone marrow and/or peripheral blood in a patient with a history of chronic leukemia._That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Sudden increase of the number of blasts in the bone marrow and/or peripheral blood in a patient with a history of chronic leukemia.

Concepts.definition: Sudden increase of the number of blasts in the bone marrow and/or peripheral blood in a patient with a history of chronic leukemia.

Property.preferredDefinition: Criteria; a basis for comparison; a reference point against which other things can be evaluated.

Concepts.definition: That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.value: Large foci or cluster of blasts in the bone marrow biopsy
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Focus Or Cluster Blast Count Bone Marrow Biopsy Large

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Focus Or Cluster Blast Count Bone Marrow Biopsy Large
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Area of greatest concentration, attention, or activity; a central point or locus, especially of an infection.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A grouping of a number of similar things.: The determination of the number of blast cells present in a blood sample.: A biopsy involving the removal of a core tissue containing bone spicules and hematopoietic elements embedded in the marrow stroma.  This procedure is done in the hip area mainly for the diagnosis and evaluation of neoplastic and non-neoplastic hematopoietic disorders (e.g. anemias, leukemias, lymphomas) and the evaluation of the spread of solid tumors (e.g. carcinomas, sarcomas) and lymphomas for therapeutic purposes.: Of considerable or relatively great size, extent, or capacity.

Concepts.definition: Area of greatest concentration, attention, or activity; a central point or locus, especially of an infection.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A grouping of a number of similar things.
The determination of the number of blast cells present in a biospecimen.

A biopsy involving the removal of a core tissue containing bone spicules and hematopoietic elements embedded in the marrow stroma.  This procedure is done in the hip area mainly for the diagnosis and evaluation of neoplastic and non-neoplastic hematopoietic disorders (e.g. anemias, leukemias, lymphomas) and the evaluation of the spread of solid tumors (e.g. carcinomas, sarcomas) and lymphomas for therapeutic purposes.
Of considerable or relatively great size, extent, or capacity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Multiplication or reproduction by cell division of immature precursor cells that have not achieved a fully differentiated state. (NCI): Outside of, or unrelated to, any medulla, especially the medulla oblongata.

Concepts.definition: Multiplication or reproduction by cell division of immature precursor cells that have not achieved a fully differentiated state. (NCI)
Outside of, or unrelated to, any medulla, especially the medulla oblongata.

PermissibleValues.value: Blasts greater than or equal to 20% of peripheral white blood cells or of nucleated bone marrow cells
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Blasts More than 20 Percent of Bone Marrow Nucleated Cells

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Blasts More than 20 Percent of Bone Marrow Nucleated Cells
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A semi-quantitative microscopic finding indicating that more than 20 percent of the nucleated cells in a bone marrow sample are immature mononuclear cells.

Concepts.longName: Blasts More than 20 Percent of Bone Marrow Nucleated Cells
Concepts.definition: A semi-quantitative microscopic finding indicating that more than 20 percent of the nucleated cells in a bone marrow sample are immature mononuclear cells.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
